text: The 1996 African Cup of Nations was the 20th edition of the Africa Cup of Nations. The tournament was held from 13 January to 3 February in South Africa. It was also won by South Africa. The top scorer was Kalusha Bwalya, with 5 goals. The winner of this tournament qualified for the 1997 FIFA Confederations Cup tournament in Saudi Arabia. == Teams == * (Group 4 runners- up) * (Group 6 winners) * (Group 7 winners) * (Group 1 runners-up) * (Group 7 runners-up) * (Group 4 winners) * (Group 5 winners) * (Group 3 winners) * (Group 2 runners-up) * (Group 6 runners-up) * (1994 winners) * (Group 3 runners-up) * (Host) * (Group 2 winners) * (Group 1 winners) * (Group 5 runners-up) == Group stage == === Group A === Pos Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts 1 3 2 0 1 4 1 +3 6 2 3 2 0 1 4 3 +1 6 3 3 1 1 1 5 7 –2 4 4 3 0 1 2 4 6 –2 1 13 January 1996 align=right 15 January 1996 align=right 18 January 1996 align=right 20 January 1996 align=right 24 January 1996 align=right align=right === Group B === Pos Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts 1 3 2 1 0 9 1 +8 7 2 3 2 1 0 4 1 +3 7 3 3 1 0 2 2 7 –5 3 4 3 0 0 3 3 9 –6 0 14 January 1996 align=right 15 January 1996 align=right 18 January 1996 align=right 20 January 1996 align=right 24 January 1996 align=right align=right === Group C === Pos Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts 1 2 1 0 1 3 2 +1 3 2 2 1 0 1 2 2 0 3 3 2 1 0 1 2 3 –1 3 16 January 1996 align=right 19 January 1996 align=right 25 January 1996 align=right === Group D === Pos Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts 1 3 3 0 0 6 1 +5 9 2 3 1 1 1 5 4 +1 4 3 3 1 0 2 2 5 –3 3 4 3 0 1 2 1 4 –3 1 14 January 1996 align=right 16 January 1996 align=right 19 January 1996 align=right 21 January 1996 align=right 25 January 1996 align=right align=right == Knockout stage == == Other websites == * Details at RSSSF * Details at www.angelfire.com Category:Africa Cup of Nations tournaments Category:Football in South Africa Category:1996 in association football Category:1996 in Africa Category:1996 events Category:1990s in South Africa
